text: Men feel that cruelty to the poor is a kind of cruelty to animals. They never feel that it is an injustice to equals nay it is treachery to comrades.
author: Gilbert K. Chesterton

text: Fable is more historical than fact, because fact tells us about one man and fable tells us about a million men.
author: Gilbert K. Chesterton

text: All men commend patience, although few are willing to practice it.
author: Thomas a Kempis

text: Republicans are men of narrow vision, who are afraid of the future.
author: Jimmy Carter

text: Death, so called, is a thing which makes men weep, And yet a third of life is passed in sleep.
author: Lord Byron
